parameters.hale: a numeric vector for health adjusted life expectancy (in years)
parameters.totexphlth: a numeric vector for total expenditures on health
parameters.pubhlthexppgdp: a numeric vector for public health expenditures as a percentage of GDP
parameters.log_vanhanen: a numeric vector for (log-transformed) racial-linguistic-religious heterogeneity
parameters.iso3c: a three-character ISO code for the country
parameters.rivalry: a dummy variable indicating the presence of an enduring international rivalry for the country
parameters.polity: a numeric vector communicating a Polity score, as a measure of the democratic nature of the country's regime
parameters.log_educ: a numeric vector for (log-transformed) educational attainment
parameters.urban_growth: a numeric vector for the pace of urbanization
parameters.cwdeaths: a numeric vector for civil war deaths
parameters.log_gdppc: a numeric vector for (log-transformed) GDP per capita
parameters.prvhlthexpgdp: a numeric vector for private spending on health as a percentage of GDP
parameters.country: a character vector denoting a country name
parameters.gini: a numeric vector for income inequality
parameters.contig_cw: a dummy variable communicating whether there is a civil war in a geographically contiguous territory

description:
Description
This is a data set for replicating Ghobarah et al. (2004), a reduced form of
what they make available on Dataverse for replication. Variables have been
renamed for legibility.
title: Comparative Public Health: The Political Economy of Human Misery and Well-Being
reference:
The three-character ISO code is the only new addition to the data. I
add this because the country names they have in the data are not neat and may
lead users astray if they wanted to search for a specific observation. The
ISO code for Yugoslavia (Serbia and Montenegro) around this time was "SCG".
format: A data frame with 182 observations on the following 15 variables.
